xxl.core.io
Interface FilesystemOperations

All Known Implementing Classes:
FATFilesystemOperations, JavaFilesystemOperations, LogFilesystemOperations, RawAccessArrayFilesystemOperations
public interface FilesystemOperations

This interface encapsulates the operations usually needed on a filesystem. By switching such an object, other classes store their information on a certain filesystem.

See Also:
BlockFileContainer

Method Detail

openFile

java.io.RandomAccessFile openFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                                  java.lang.String mode)
Opens a file and returns a RandomAccessFile.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file.
mode - the access mode ("r" or "rw").
Returns:
the new RandomAccessFile or null, if the operation was not successful.

fileExists

boolean fileExists(java.lang.String fileName)
Determines if a file exists or not.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file to be checked.
Returns:
true iff the file exists.

renameFile

boolean renameFile(java.lang.String oldName,
                   java.lang.String newName)
Renames the name of a file to a new name.

Parameters:
oldName - the old name of the file.
newName - the new name of the file.
Returns:
true iff the operation completed successfully.

deleteFile

boolean deleteFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Deletes a file.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file.
Returns:
true iff the operation completed successfully.
